key.name: edge-scrolling-enabled
key.description: When enabled, touchpads that support edge scrolling will have that feature enabled.

key.name: two-finger-scrolling-enabled
key.description: When enabled, touchpads that support two-finger scrolling will have that feature enabled.

key.name: disable-while-typing
key.summary: Whether to disable the touchpad while typing
key.description: When enabled, touchpads will be disabled while typing on the keyboard.

key.name: tap-to-click
key.description: Set this to TRUE to be able to send mouse clicks by tapping on the touchpad.

key.name: tap-button-map
key.description: Defines the mapping between the number of fingers and touchpad buttons. The default is to have a 1, 2 and 3 finger tap to map to the left, right and middle button ("lrm"), respectively.

key.name: tap-and-drag
key.description: Set this to TRUE to be able to start a drag by tapping and immediately moving the finger that’s now pressed on the touchpad.

key.name: tap-and-drag-lock
key.description: Set this to TRUE to lock the dragging process within a short timeout when the finger is lifted on the touchpad and the tap-and-drag setting is enabled.

key.name: send-events
key.description: Defines the situations in which the touchpad is enabled.

key.name: left-handed
key.description: Swap left and right mouse buttons for left-handed mice with “left”, “right” for right-handed, “mouse” to follow the mouse setting.

key.name: speed
key.description: Pointer speed for the touchpad. Accepted values are in the [-1..1] range (from “unaccelerated” to “fast”). A value of 0 is the system default.

key.name: natural-scroll
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable natural (reverse) scrolling for touchpads.

key.name: click-method
key.description: How to generate software-emulated buttons, either disabled (“none”), through specific areas (“areas”), number of fingers (“fingers”) or left as hardware default (“default”).

key.name: middle-click-emulation
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable middle click during simultaneous left and right click.

key.name: repeat
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable keyboard repeat.

key.name: repeat-interval
key.description: Delay between repeats in milliseconds.

key.name: delay
key.description: Initial key repeat delay in milliseconds.

key.name: remember-numlock-state
key.description: When set to true, GNOME will remember the state of the NumLock LED between sessions.

key.name: numlock-state
key.description: The remembered state of the NumLock LED.

key.name: left-handed
key.description: Swap left and right mouse buttons for left-handed mice.

key.name: speed
key.description: Pointer speed for mice. Accepted values are in the [-1..1] range (from “unaccelerated” to “fast”). A value of 0 is the system default.

key.name: natural-scroll
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable natural (reverse) scrolling for mice.

key.name: accel-profile
key.description: Acceleration profile used for connected mice. The acceleration profile can be set to either default (“default”) which uses the default acceleration profile for each device, flat (“flat”), which accelerates by a device specific constant factor derived from the configured pointer speed, or adaptive (“adaptive”) which adapts the acceleration depending on the mouse movement. If a mouse doesn’t support the configured profile, “default” will be used.

key.name: middle-click-emulation
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable middle click during simultaneous left and right click.

key.name: double-click
key.description: Length of a double click in milliseconds.

key.name: drag-threshold
key.description: Distance before a drag is started.

key.name: output
key.description: EDID information of the output the tablet is mapped to. Must be in the format [vendor, product, serial]. ["","",""] relies on automatic mapping.

key.name: mapping
key.description: How input affects the pointer on the screen

key.name: area
key.description: Dead area padding around the active area, in percentages. Respectively applied to left,right,top and bottom sides.

key.name: keep-aspect
key.description: Enable this to restrict the tablet area to match the aspect ratio of the output.

key.name: left-handed
key.description: Enable this to allow physically rotating the tablet for left-handed setups

key.name: pressure-curve
key.description: Set this to x1, y1 and x2, y2 of the pressure curve applied to the stylus.

key.name: eraser-pressure-curve
key.description: Set this to x1, y1 and x2, y2 of the pressure curve applied to the eraser.

key.name: button-action
key.description: Stylus button action, this button is located along the pen handle.

key.name: secondary-button-action
key.description: Secondary stylus button action, this button is located along the pen handle on some styli like the Grip Pen. Other styli like the Airbrush Pen or the Inking Pen only have one button, this setting is ineffective on those.

key.name: tertiary-button-action
key.description: Tertiary stylus button action, this button is located along the pen handle on some styli like the 3D Pen. Other styli like the Grip Pen only have two buttons, this setting is ineffective on those.

key.name: action
key.description: The type of action triggered by the button being pressed.

key.name: keybinding
key.summary: Key combination for the custom action
key.description: The keyboard shortcut generated when the button is pressed for custom actions.

key.name: output
key.description: EDID information of the output the touchscreen is mapped to. Must be in the format [vendor, product, serial]. ["","",""] relies on automatic mapping.

key.name: scroll-wheel-emulation-button
key.summary: Mouse wheel emulation button. 0 to disable the feature.

key.name: scroll-wheel-emulation-button-lock
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable button locking for the wheel emulation button. If enabled, the first click of the button enables scrolling, the second click disables scrolling again.

key.name: accel-profile
key.description: Acceleration profile used for the trackball. The acceleration profile can be set to either default (“default”) which uses the default acceleration profile, flat (“flat”), which accelerates by a device specific constant factor derived from the configured speed, or adaptive (“adaptive”) which adapts the acceleration depending on the movement. If the trackball doesn’t support the configured profile, “default” will be used.

key.name: middle-click-emulation
key.description: Set this to TRUE to enable middle click during simultaneous left and right click.
